body_html: The mathematical concept of a gradient is defined only when the output is a single scalar. (If you give TensorFlow an output that isn't a scalar, it will give you the gradient of the sum). You probably want a Jacobian. So you'd need to make a loop that computes the gradient once per entry in the output.
body_text: The mathematical concept of a gradient is defined only when the output is a single scalar. (If you give TensorFlow an output that isn't a scalar, it will give you the gradient of the sum). You probably want a Jacobian. So you'd need to make a loop that computes the gradient once per entry in the output.
body: The mathematical concept of a gradient is defined only when the output is a single scalar. (If you give TensorFlow an output that isn't a scalar, it will give you the gradient of the sum). You probably want a Jacobian. So you'd need to make a loop that computes the gradient once per entry in the output.
